attires.name: Henna (Mehndi) - Traditional
attires.description: Traditional henna designs extending from the palms to the forearms, featuring intricate floral and paisley patterns.

attires.name: Henna (Mehndi) - Arabic Style
attires.description: Arabic style henna with bold, flowing lines and less intricate filling, often extending from the palm to the forearm.

attires.name: Henna (Mehndi) - Rajasthani Style
attires.description: Highly detailed Rajasthani henna designs covering the forearm, popular for weddings and special occasions.

attires.name: Kada (Thick Bangle)
attires.description: A thick, usually metallic bangle worn on the forearm, common among men and women, especially in Punjab and Sikh culture.

attires.name: Vanki (Armlet)
attires.description: A traditional South Indian armlet, often V-shaped and ornate, worn by brides and classical dancers.

attires.name: Tattoo (Traditional)
attires.description: Traditional tattoos, such as Godna, found among tribal communities in Central and Eastern India, often on the forearms.

attires.name: Khanjar Embroidered Cuffs
attires.description: Traditional Kashmiri cuffs with intricate Khanjar embroidery, often seen on pheran sleeves.

attires.name: Gara Embroidered Sleeves
attires.description: Parsee Gara embroidery on sleeve cuffs, featuring floral and bird motifs, worn during special occasions.

attires.name: Zardozi Embroidered Cuffs
attires.description: Richly decorated cuffs with gold and silver Zardozi embroidery, popular in Mughal and Muslim wedding attire.

attires.name: North East Tribal Beaded Arm Band
attires.description: Colorful beaded arm bands worn by various North Eastern tribes as part of traditional dress.

attires.name: Gond Tribal Tattoo Patterns
attires.description: Distinctive tattoo patterns found among Gond and Santhal tribal communities, often on the forearms.
